page.title: 08BLUEGATES DAIRY SITE
page.content: Blugates Dairy farm was built on the site of an orchard. Farms used to keep all kinds of animals and grow all kinds of crops. They needed to feed all the workmen and their families. What was left was sold to the village. Farmers don't usually do this now they grow fewer crops. The villagers go to shops to buy food, they tend to go further and further to larger shops. A general store in the village has just closed down.There are fewer farmworkers others live in the cottages. Some however are not in a convenient place for commuters, like the one next to the mud and smell of the new dairy buildings.These are just left to fall down. Others are much modified and become very desirable residences. Some older farm buildings are not kept in good repair but are used temporarilly for storeage.
